data.title: Great atmosphere!!
data.text: Very unique with beautiful tables and chairs, real China dish ware and cloth napkins!  The food was delicious. Went with a friend who had been several times. I will be back with my friends and family

data.title: Authentic sichuan
data.text:
Wonderful food with huge portions.  Duck gizzard needed a bit more flavor.  Pork with garlic was great, orange beef delicious and cooked perfect...not over cooked. Pork buns the best. A bit on the expensive side but worth it.  

Service mixed because food not served for whole table....one plate at a time.....but food delicious.  This really is cooked to order!

data.title: "One of a kind"
data.text: This is not a chow mein or orange chicken place; the owner is direct from Szechuan Province in China, and she brought her cooking skills with her.  In her kitchen dishes are prepared that have made this part of China famous for its cuisine, and she takes no short-cuts with the ingredients. The menu is extensive and exotic---any menu that offers a section entitled "Visceral" and features "Duck Gizzard", "Steam Intestines", and "Pork Ear" gets my attention---but in my numerous visits here I have stuck with the more conventional "Shredded Pork with Garlic Sauce," "Chicken Ball with Garlic Sauce", "Sweet and Sour Cabbage", and "Mapo Tofu" (a Szechuan classic). This is a cuisine that calls for a liberal use of peppers, so if you are averse to hot and spicy then request a reduction in their use with your server (tip:  ask for the owner to come to your table; she is very welcoming and enjoys discussing her menu).  Portions are large and inexpensive (in the nine to thirteen dollar range), and each will be adequate for 2-3 people.  The tables and chairs were shipped from Shanghai, and with a little imagination you can feel that you are there.  If your mind works that way then this is your place.  Otherwise, there's a Panda Express down the road.

data.title: A Wonderful of Experience of Flavor
data.text: I went to CIE Sichuan with a group of friends feeling very excited because I was told we would have authentic Sichuan. This was something I missed since coming to California. In my former hometown we had such a place to feast on authentic flavors from China. Although I love the food of our local Chinese diners around here, they are tame to wonderful real flavors of the Sichuan region. Not that everything is hot like fire mixed with chilis, but rather full of flavor that makes you wish to enjoy your meal, not eat quickly. The service was very prompt and friendly. The place was clean, and very accommodating for special needs, mobility issues. The menu with photos is full of wonderful offerings. Some are probably new to the local folk, but try them. You will not only learn how another part of the world dines, but you might wish you had grown up there as well. I had the fish cooked in a wonderful chili oil sauce. The fish was fresh and moist, and full of a luscious warm flavor. Not overpowering hot, but comforting. It along with the Hot and Sour Soup made me feel very comfortable, and helped me relax and enjoy the whole experience of dining with my friends. I watch my friends enjoy their meals, from lamb to poultry, and vegetarian. All complimenting the freshness and surprisingly wonderful flavors of Sichuan cooking. Go, you will be very happy. For me, who missed my former home's authentic Sichuan flavors, it was like a homecoming.

data.title: Love this place
data.text: We have been to China and really enjoy the Sichuan style cooking. This place is authentic.  The menu is an adventure for the tastebuds.  Their Ma poo tofu is the best. We also enjoyed the pork belly. There are dishes for the less adventurist, but if you want an authentic Chinese meal...this is it.

data.title: One hit; one miss
data.text:
This is the type of nice, new restaurant you want to succeed.  The Coachella Valley's Chinese restaurants are remarkably dismal, and we were excited that some new entrepreneurs were bold enough to try Sichuanese - which is not to everyone's liking (lots of peppery flavors and for the finicky American palate, exotic ingredients.

Our first visit was really good - just a few customers, and good food, including their signature peppery frogs legs with enoki mushrooms.

So we were excited to take friends from the coast when they came for a visit.  Alas, disaster struck, and the fundamental flaws of the restaurant came to the fore and left us pulling our hair out - almost literally.

Beijing Duck requires one day notice.  We gave it.  They had no record of it.  Then I asked that it be served as the first, appetizer course, and chaos/disaster ensued.

The restaurant was full (unlike the first time), and when that happens no one is in charge. Four people tried to take our order. The order was taken at 6:00 pm.  At 7:20, when nothing had appeared, I went into the kitchen to ask where our food was.  Then, having gotten their attention (other people meanwhile had arrived, ordered, been served, finished, and left) the food began arriving - in reverse order from the way it should have been.

What was served was just blah.  It was like an entirely different restaurant and experience from the first time.  We were embarrassed to have brought guests.

We should probably give them another chance, but maybe when they've decided to get organized and take the restaurant
business seriously.

data.title: Interesting Menu
data.text: Stopped for lunch and was astonished. The menu was large and had a lot of different items that I had not seen before. The Special Lunch Menu had the day of the week special so I had that. VERY spicy for me . My friend that it was great. Be prepared if you cannot eat spicy foods as the spice cannot be removed in the specials. The owner said that on the regular menu you can request less spice. Beer menu was small. Service was great and the interior had many vases and statues and other items that made the place interesting. Prices were in line with other Asian food restaurants. Stop in to see and try the unique items on the menu.

data.title: At Last!
data.text: CIE Sichuan is the authentic Chinese that the Coachella Valley has been needing!  The menu is quite extensive, the flavors really amazing.  The food arrived piping hot and was a real joy to savor.

data.title: Amazing authentic cuisine
data.text: Spicy made to order, lots of amazing choices. Clean, new, fresh Asian ambiance. Casual, family, small groups & even tables for two. You will enjoy the experience of trying new favors.
